thread.title: Pep Guardiola to beat Louis van Gaal's record as he reaches 100 UEFA club matches in Monaco
thread.title_full: Pep Guardiola to beat Louis van Gaal's record as he reaches 100 UEFA club matches in Monaco

author: Alex Richards
title: Pep Guardiola to beat Louis van Gaal's record as he reaches 100 UEFA club matches in Monaco
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola to beat Louis van Gaal's record as he reaches 100 UEFA club matches in Monaco Guardiola leads City into their Champions League second round clash against Monaco, where he will reach another milestone Share Guardiola's record is astonishing (Photo: PA) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Pep Guardiola will become the 29th coach to reach the 100-game milestone in UEFA club competitions on Wednesday night, when he leads out Manchester City against Monaco. 
The Spaniard joins an elite group including Arsene Wenger, Sir Alex Ferguson, Jose Mourinho, Valeriy Lobanovskiy and Fabio Capello to have reached the century. And the City boss hits the very top of the pile - win, lose or draw at the Stade Louis II. 
Guardiola’s 99 games in charge of City, Bayern Munich and Barcelona have seen the Catalan coach land 61 wins and 23 draws. 
That doesn’t include a 2008-09 quarter-final success over Bayern, when Tito Vilanova took charge of Barca, with Guardiola banned from the touchline. 
It is already better than the man with the best record after 100 matches: Louis van Gaal. Guardiola will have the best record of any manager in Euro competitions after 100 games (Photo: REUTERS) Louis van Gaal, a Guardiola mentor, will fall to No.2 (Photo: Man Utd/Getty) 
The former Manchester United boss entered the 100 club with a record of 61 wins, 22 draws and 17 defeats, claimed during his time in charge of Ajax and Barcelona. 
The Dutchman won both the Champions League (1994-95) and UEFA Cup (1991-92) With Ajax and the UEFA Super Cup with both teams (Ajax 1995; Barcelona 1997). 
Guardiola - who played under Van Gaal at Barcelona - has already claimed the Champions League (2008-09, 2010-11) with Barca, as well as taking two Super Cups (2009, 2011) to Camp Nou. He added a third in 2013, in his debut season at Bayern. 
His move to the top of the pile will see him push Van Gaal into second, with current Newcastle boss Rafa Benitez slipping to third. He won 60, drew 22 and lost 18 of his first 100 games in charge in European football, and has won five UEFA trophies with Valencia, Liverpool and Chelsea. Read More Coaches' records in UEFA competitions after 100 games
